intro: Miconia santos-limae, commonly known as the Santos-Lima miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest biome of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in the region. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
